inputs.selection_motivation: Fed policy has the weakest direct influence on GBP/USD compared to rates, commodities, and FX peers, and its correlation is largely mediated through US rates, making it the least valuable link for current analytics.

prioritized_link.motivation: GBP/USD is strongly driven by expectations of US inflation relative to UK, so it correlates with US inflation.

source_node.query: ((GBPUSD OR GBP/USD OR GBPUSD* OR "GBP/USD" OR "GBPUSD" OR "GBP USD" OR "British Pound" OR "Pound Sterling" OR "Sterling" OR "GBP") AND (USD OR "US Dollar" OR "Dollar" OR "US$" OR "USD$")) AND (exchange rate OR currency OR forex OR FX OR "foreign exchange" OR "currency pair" OR "FX pair") AND (news OR analysis OR trend OR market OR volatility OR movement OR change OR shift OR impact OR report OR update OR outlook OR forecast) AND (inflation OR "interest rate" OR rates OR "central bank" OR "Bank of England" OR BoE OR "BoE policy" OR "BoE rates" OR "BoE decision" OR "BoE meeting" OR Fed OR ECB OR BoJ OR PBoC OR "monetary policy" OR "fiscal policy") AND (economic OR economy OR GDP OR growth OR recession OR recovery)
source_node.name: GBP/USD
